title: Elon Musk Says Tesla Suspends Accepting Bitcoin for Vehicle Purchases
summary: Tesla chief says bitcoin will be used for transactions 'as soon as mining transitions to more sustainable energy'. Tesla Inc. Chief Executive Elon Musk said the company has suspended accepting bitcoin as payment for its vehicles.

title: NRA Bankruptcy Case Is Dismissed. What Happens Next?
summary: Gun-rights group's leaders face intensifying scrutiny in New York after a Dallas judge said it can't continue with its proposed bankruptcy reorganization. U.S. Bankruptcy Judge Harlin Hale on Tuesday threw the National Rifle Association out of chapter 11 following a monthlong trial that examined how the organization is managed under CEO Wayne LaPierre and his motivations to put the 150-year old gun-rights group into bankruptcy. Here is what you need to know about the bankruptcy case, and next steps the NRA may take.

title: New York City Council Bill Toughens Airbnb Regulations
summary: Apartments rented through home-sharing sites would have to register with the city if the legislation passes. Apartments rented through Airbnb Inc. and other home-sharing sites would have to be registered with New York City under a city council bill introduced Wednesday.

title: Bill Ackman Talks SPACs, Domino's, Inflation, Crypto and New York City
summary: Here are some of the top takeaways from the billionaire investor. Published May 12, 2021 7:33 pm ET

title: Biden Signs Cybersecurity Order to Boost U.S. Defenses Against Hacks
summary: Move comes amid a wave of major hacks, such as this week's pipeline shutdown and SolarWinds espionage campaign. WASHINGTON-President Biden on Wednesday ordered U.S. agencies and software contractors that supply them to boost their defenses against cyberattacks that officials say pose a growing threat to national security and public safety.

title: Bumble's Debut Has Been a Buzz Kill
summary: The dating app's banter hasn't delivered the picture it sold in its initial public offering. For a company built around empowering its users to make the first move, Bumble Inc.'s first impression hasn't exactly been a gentle letdown. Its shares have fallen nearly 38% from where they opened on the company's Feb. 11 initial public offering. Wednesday's first quarter results didn't do much to rekindle investors' love: The stock traded flat after hours after losing 6% on the day.

title: Truckers Seek to Keep Diesel Supplies Flowing in Pipeline Shutdown
summary: Fuel prices are rising as trucking companies watch for shortfalls in availability. Prices are rising for diesel fuel used to transport freight as fallout from the Colonial Pipeline shutdown strains capacity for truckers that deliver fuel to gas stations.

title: Colonial Pipeline Restarts Operations After Cyberattack
summary: The owner of the primary fuel conduit for the East Coast said full restoration of service would take days. The owner of the Colonial Pipeline said Wednesday that it has begun restarting operations following a cyberattack that shut down the main fuel conduit serving the East Coast.

title: Facebook-Backed Digital Currency Revamps to Address U.S. Concerns
summary: Dollar-backed Diem will be based in the U.S., take steps to address money-laundering qualms. WASHINGTON-A Facebook Inc. -backed digital currency project is being revamped in a bid to address concerns among U.S. officials that it could be used for money laundering and other illicit purposes.

title: Boeing Nears Fix for 777 Engine Covers
summary: Plane maker is close to completing proposal to strengthen components as United looks to return jets to service after Colorado debris incident. Boeing Co. is nearing a fix for engine covers like the one that broke apart on a United Airlines 777 jet over Colorado earlier this year, people briefed on the matter said.

title: Republicans Reject Tax Increases After Biden Infrastructure Talks
summary: Disagreements over the size of the infrastructure plan also remain. WASHINGTON-The top Republicans on Capitol Hill told President Biden Wednesday they would oppose any effort to raise taxes to pay for an infrastructure proposal, leaving a central issue in the talks unresolved as Republicans and Democrats search for a bipartisan compromise.

title: Tesla's April Sales From China Were Mostly Exports
summary: New figures raise questions about the strength of demand for its vehicles in the world's largest auto market. SHANGHAI- Tesla Inc. exported most of the cars produced at its Shanghai factory in April, in a sign of how much the electric-vehicle maker is using the Chinese plant to satisfy demand outside the country.

title: Powell Gets His Inflation Wish
summary: The Fed Chairman wanted higher prices. Let's hope it's 'transitory.'. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell's inflation ship has come in, albeit more rudely than he probably wanted. The consumer price index rose a remarkable 4.2% at an annual rate in April, and 3% in the core measure that excludes food and energy. Mr. Powell wanted more inflation, and now he's got it.

title: A Dangerous Pick at Justice
summary: Susan Hennessey's Russia role undermined electoral legitimacy.. Even as the 2020 stolen-election myth continues to tear at the GOP, the Biden Administration is elevating a key figure in the campaign to delegitimize Donald Trump's election in 2016.

title: CDC Recommends Covid-19 Vaccine for 12- to 15-Year-Olds
summary: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention took step after its vaccination advisory panel voted Wednesday to back the shot. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommended Wednesday that 12- to 15-year-olds receive the Covid-19 vaccine from Pfizer Inc. and BioNTech SE, expanding the nation's vaccination campaign.

title: Coronavirus Pandemic Rewrites Job Description for Some CIOs
summary: CIOs at Toyota Financial Services and Oshkosh see leadership extending beyond technology to office design and culture. Information technology leaders are taking on a wider range of responsibilities during the coronavirus pandemic, said two chief information officers in an event organized in part by academic leaders at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

title: The Jones Act Strikes Again
summary: Biden considers another waiver, but the real answer is to sink it.. Every time America suffers a disaster that harms fuel distribution, we get a fresh reminder of the high price America pays for the 1920 Jones Act. So it is with the gas shortages caused by a cyber attack that last Friday shut down the Colonial Pipeline, which supplies roughly 45% of gasoline and oil for the East Coast. On Wednesday the Biden Administration said it "stands ready" to consider requests from shippers for a Jones Act waiver to allow more ships to transport fuel where it's needed.

title: 'For the People' Is About Helping the Party
summary: The Senate takes up a voting bill designed to rig the system in favor of Democrats.. It was only a fundraising appeal, but Sen. Cory Booker (D., N.J.) made a few big mistakes when he asked Tuesday, "Will we let today's Republican Party revive Jim Crow, seize partisan control over how elections are run, and impose permanent undemocratic control of government?"

title: Derek Chauvin Can Face a Longer Sentence, Judge Rules
summary: A lawyer for one of the other former officers alleged the state's chief medical examiner was coerced into testifying that neck compression played a role in George Floyd's death. A Minnesota judge has ruled that the former Minneapolis police officer convicted of murdering George Floyd can receive an aggravated prison sentence, allowing for one tougher than recommended by state guidelines.

title: Who Really Pays for ESG Investing?
summary: BlackRock and others bill the cost to middle-income investors, in the form of lower returns.. Workers with pensions or 401(k)s trust financial institutions to make the best investments for their retirement incomes. An increasing number of portfolio managers say they maximize returns with their Environmental, Social and Corporate Governance, or ESG, investment criteria. But is that true, and is it the proper role of financial institutions?

title: The $392,000 Lifeguard: 'Baywatch' as Union Shop
summary: Savvy bargaining has gotten them handsome benefits and six-figure salaries.. Being a lifeguard isn't easy, but in Los Angeles it can be lucrative. Auditors at OpenTheBooks.com found 82 county lifeguards earning at least $200,000 including benefits and seven making between $300,000 and $392,000. Thirty-one lifeguards made between $50,000 and $131,000 in overtime alone.

title: A Wrong Number Made My Day
summary: I don't want to buy an Aston Martin, but I enjoy being reminded of James Bond.. You might not think that someone calling a wrong number could light up your day.

title: 'Madhouse at the End of the Earth' Review: Freezing for Belgium
summary: Representing a young nation, the ship descended on Antarctica. The crew made 20 landings before getting stuck in the ice.. On Aug. 16, 1897, 20,000 Belgians lined the wharves of Antwerp to wave off the Belgica, a 113-foot three-masted steam whaler. She was departing for Antarctica, still a land of fable in the last years of the 19th century. Belgium had declared independence from Holland only 67 years earlier, and with the voyage of the Belgica, writes Julian Sancton, the young nation "was staking a claim to the next frontier of human exploration."

title: Is the American Work Ethic Dying?
summary: Covid laid off much of the country. Now the Biden Democrats are paying people to stay home.. Joe Biden likes to say, "It's simple." Sometimes, it isn't.

title: Times Square Shooting Suspect Is Arrested in Florida
summary: Farrakhan Muhammad is accused of firing a gun during a dispute; two women and a child were hit by stray bullets. A man accused of firing a gun and wounding two women and a 4-year-old in Times Square was arrested Wednesday in Florida, New York Police Department officials said.

title: Police Arrest Tesla Driver, Saying He Operated Car From Back Seat
summary: Tesla Model 3 driver is charged with reckless driving after police receive 911 calls. Police in California arrested the driver of a Tesla for allegedly operating the vehicle from the back seat.

title: New York City Jails Are in Disorder, Federal Monitor Says
summary: Report by federal monitor was issued as the city's Department of Correction undergoes a leadership change. The New York City jail system is in disorder and use of force against inmates is at a five-year high, a court-appointed federal monitor said in a newly published report.

title: Death Toll Rises as Israel-Hamas Fighting Intensifies
summary: Israel says it killed 14 senior Hamas commanders and officials; wave of communal clashes between Jewish and Arab Israelis spreads. TEL AVIV-Israel's military said it killed 14 senior Hamas commanders and officials as it intensified its airstrikes targeting the militant group in Gaza, as a wave of communal clashes between Jewish and Arab Israelis spread within the country's borders.

title: Inflation Data Test Fed's Strategy and Outlook
summary: Policy makers expect stronger inflationary pressures to fade before the labor market recovers. More economists are questioning that view.. WASHINGTON-Federal Reserve officials have said increases in inflation this year will likely prove moderate and temporary, allowing them to hold interest rates near zero for years to come.

title: Cathie Wood's ARK Stumbles as Tech Trade Unwinds
summary: ARK Investment's funds sink further than broader market during May's selloff in shares of tech and other fast-growing companies. Cathie Wood's ARK Investment Management LLC is bearing the brunt of the stock market's faltering technology trade, again.

title: Colombian Mass Protests Over Covid-19 Woes Paralyze Cali
summary: Road blockades have shut business in the city and strangled farms, foreshadowing unrest in other countries over economic hardship. CALI, Colombia-Days of rowdy, sometimes violent protests have choked off this city of 2.2 million, disrupting food supplies, paralyzing business and sending a warning to political leaders that the pain generated by the pandemic can sow chaos that is difficult to control.

title: 'Fall River' Review: A Small Town's 'Satanic Panic'
summary: A docuseries on Epix explores three murders that racked the Massachusetts community best known as Lizzie Borden's hometown.. title: Tin Prices Soar on Electronics Demand, Shipping Trouble
summary: The metal has climbed 46% in 2021 and is approaching record highs. High demand for consumer electronics and difficulties shipping metal out of Asia have created a shortage of tin, pushing prices for the metal close to records for the first time in a decade.

title: 'Awaken: A Tibetan Buddhist Journey Toward Enlightenment' Review: Meditations on Suffering and Being
summary: The Rubin Museum of Art provides a rich exploration of a single meditative practice starting with the Buddha's own spiritual reappraisal..

title: Biden Pressured to Take Sides in Clash Between Israelis and Palestinians
summary: The administration pushes for calm, while some Democrats seek support for Palestinians and some Republicans want more backing for Israel. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration is urging a de-escalation in deadly clashes between the Israeli military and the Islamist Hamas movement, while some Democratic allies call for stronger support for Palestinians and some Republicans want more forceful backing of Israel.

title: Judge Says Revlon Lenders Can Access Citi's Mistaken Loan Payment
summary: Revlon lenders that received roughly $500 million in an erroneous transaction from Citigroup can use the money while the bank's appeal is pending. Lenders to Revlon Inc. that received roughly $500 million from Citigroup Inc. last year due to a back-office blunder are allowed to use the money as they see fit, a federal judge ruled Wednesday, unfreezing the funds.

title: Electric-Vehicle Firms Push for Their Own Dealerships in New York
summary: State law requires most auto makers to sell cars through a third party. ALBANY, N.Y.-Electric-vehicle companies want New York lawmakers to let them open more dealerships in the state, a move that they and environmental groups said would expand sales of emission-free cars and trucks.

title: WeWork CEO Says Least Engaged Employees Enjoy Working From Home
summary: But time in the office is essential, even in flexible, hybrid-work models, Sandeep Mathrani says. Author

summary: Former acting defense secretary tells House panel the military's response was proper when pro-Trump mob sought to prevent certification of Biden election. Two former senior Trump administration officials defended their efforts to help secure the Capitol during the pro-Trump Jan. 6 riot in their first testimony about the attack.

title: The Inflation 'Tug-of-War'
summary: Can the short-term surge avoid inflicting long-term damage?. Inflation is surging as Washington prints and spends money at historic levels. Meanwhile Covid-related policies are still making it hard for businesses to staff up and increase production. A former Trump economic adviser isn't the only one concerned that too much money chasing too few goods may be more than a temporary problem.

title: Gas Prices Hit $3 a Gallon as Shortage Sets In After Pipeline Hack
summary: National average price at highest level since 2014 as drivers in Southeast scramble to fill up. The average U.S. price of gasoline broke above $3 a gallon for the first time in 6½ years on Wednesday as stations along the East Coast ran low on fuel after the Colonial Pipeline was shut following a cyberattack.

title: All Rhodes Scholarships Are Based on Merit
summary: Our selectors are explicitly directed not to try to "balance" or seek diversity of gender, race, ideology, academic field or any other characteristic.. David Satter ("The Rhodes Scholarship Turns Against Its Legacy of Excellence," op-ed, May 8) suggests that the world's preeminent international graduate scholarship has been "corrupted" by being turned into a competition "rigged" by racial preference. His claims are false and misinformed.

title: Georgia Voting Law Is a Step Back for Blacks
summary: Georgia legislators reacted to powerful minority civic engagement by trying to shrink the electorate with a voting bill transparently targeted at black and brown voters.. Your editorial "What Was That About Voter Suppression?" (May 4) suggests that black turnout in 2020 was too high for voter suppression to be a problem. This is a smokescreen to obscure the shameless effort of southern states-which recently experienced a substantial black voter-registration and turnout influx-to ensure that such powerful political participation by its most marginalized citizens cannot happen again.

title: A Hamptons Living Room That's Not Too Vanilla
summary: Interior designer Elena Frampton created a $182,000 space punctuated by pops of color. "A lot of people think of a Hamptons beach house as a white vanilla house, especially when it has a view. I wanted to create something with depth," said Elena Frampton of the Southampton, N.Y., waterfront home she designed for a repeat client.

title: Student-Loan Debt Is a Burden on the Young
summary: It is time for the federal government to get out of the student-loan business.. Regarding "Inside the Fight Over Student Loan Losses" (Page One, April 30): It is time for the federal government to get out of the student-loan business. Since 1992, easy-to-secure federal student loans gave schools the green light to significantly raise tuition and fees. Higher costs made higher education less affordable. Now we find that taxpayers will be on the hook for billions of unpaid loans. How about if the schools themselves become the lenders? They could decide how to qualify student borrowers based on their credit scores and their projected ability to repay, perhaps tied to the earning potential of their degree.

title: Treasury Yields Climb Following Consumer-Price Data
summary: Rising consumer prices worry bondholders because inflation erodes the value of bonds' fixed payments. U.S. government bond yields posted their biggest one-day climb in almost two months Wednesday after new data showed consumer prices surged in April, a sign that the economic recovery is still picking up steam.

title: It's Elementary (Thursday Crossword, May 13)
Airplane Thrillers Take Off This Summer
summary: What's real and what's drama in airplane suspense novels. With Americans beginning to return to air travel this summer after more than a year away, a new selection of high-anxiety novels set on airplanes awaits them.

title: Hertz Shareholder Payout Set to Swell on Winning Bankruptcy Bid
summary: Knighthead Capital Management and Certares Management emerged as winners in a bidding war that drove up Hertz's value, generating returns for shareholders. Hertz Global Holdings Inc. selected investment firms Knighthead Capital Management LLC and Certares Management LLC as the winning bidders for control of the bankrupt company after a fierce competition drove up the expected payout for shareholders, a rarity in corporate chapter 11 cases.

title: Fewer Families and Children Arrested at Border in April
summary: Apprehensions in both groups dropped for first time in five months, but the number of single adults caught entering the U.S. illegally continued to rise. The number of migrant families and unaccompanied children crossing the border illegally dropped in April for the first time in five months, according to government data disclosed Tuesday.

title: Oil Glut Returns to Near Pre-Pandemic Levels
summary: IEA cuts global demand growth forecast as India battles Covid-19 wave. The oil supply glut that built up after the pandemic forced producing countries to slash output has almost returned to normal levels, the International Energy Agency said Wednesday.

title: German Regulator Orders Digital Bank N26 to Improve Controls
summary: BaFin is appointing monitor to check implementation at the digital financial firm, which operates in 25 markets. Germany's financial regulator has told N26 Bank GmbH, a hot digital startup with operations in Europe and the U.S., to implement proper controls to prevent money laundering, taking the unusual step of appointing a special monitor to watch over the process.

title: Macron's Party Drops Support for Candidate Over Muslim Headscarf
summary: Move sparks a backlash within France's ruling party, showing how sensitive the subject of Islam and its place in society has become ahead of an election. PARIS-French President Emmanuel Macron's party has pulled support for a Muslim woman running on its ticket in a local election in June after she wore a headscarf on a campaign poster.

title: China Weighs New Economic Envoy to U.S.
summary: Senior Chinese official Liu He, who oversaw trade deal with Trump White House, might be replaced with younger Hu Chunhua. Beijing is considering whether to replace Vice Premier Liu He as its top economic envoy with Washington, according to officials with knowledge of the matter, a decision that Biden administration officials say will indicate the depth of China's interest in economic cooperation.

title: U.S. Tariffs Drive Drop in Chinese Imports
summary: Levies now cover about $250 billion a year in goods-down from $370 billion-as U.S. companies shift purchases elsewhere. WASHINGTON-U.S. tariffs have led to a sharp decline in Chinese imports and significant changes in the types of goods Americans buy from China, new data show, with purchases of telecommunications gear, furniture, apparel and other goods shifting to other countries.

title: What to Watch: 11 Movies and Series to Stream This Week
summary: 'The Woman in the Window' brings Amy Adams and other Hollywood stars, 'The Underground Railroad' takes off, and 'The Upshaws' gives a close-up on family life. There's no shortage of Hollywood star power in new films streaming this week. "The Woman in the Window" (Friday, Netflix ), a thriller about a woman who believes she's witnessed a murder, stars Amy Adams, Julianne Moore, Gary Oldman and Jennifer Jason Leigh. In "Those Who Wish Me Dead" (Friday, HBO Max), Angelina Jolie plays a forest firefighter who takes in a boy being pursued by assassins.

title: Students Are Cheating More During The Pandemic
summary: With many students at home, and with websites offering services to do their homework, schools have seen a surge in academic dishonesty. A year of remote learning has led to cheating among students from grade school to college. With many students isolated at home over the past year-and with a mass of online services at their disposal-academic dishonesty has never been so easy. Some educators fear this trend will continue even after the pandemic recedes.

title: Ericsson to Pay Nokia $97.2 Million to Settle Damages Claim
summary: The claim related to previously announced allegations that it violated U.S. antibribery law, Ericsson says. STOCKHOLM- Ericsson AB said it would pay Nokia Corp. €80 million, equivalent to $97.2 million, to settle a damages claim relating to previously announced allegations that it violated the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act.

summary: The tricks are to not overfill the leaves, to roll them tightly and to approach each one with utter confidence. To explore and search through all our recipes, check out the new WSJ Recipes page.

title: U.S. Ran Record $1.9 Trillion Budget Deficit in First Seven Months of Fiscal Year
summary: Treasury Department says federal outlays climbed 22% to $4.1 trillion from October through April. WASHINGTON-The U.S. budget gap widened in the first seven months of the fiscal year, as federal spending continued to outpace rising tax receipts while the nation recovers from the economic fallout from the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: For Sale in Santa Barbara: 3,200 Acres of Land for $75 Million
summary: Resume Subscription. In Santa Barbara, a roughly 3,200-acre parcel of land in the foothills of Carpinteria is hitting the market for $75 million. The listing agents say it's primed for the construction of a significant single-family compound.

title: Stuffing Grape Leaves: A Recipe to Soothe Any Stressed-Out Cook
summary: This repetitive and highly pleasurable task is cooking and meditation in one. THERE IS SOMETHING deeply calming about stuffing a grape leaf. Trust me, I know. In the early months of the pandemic, I found solace in my kitchen and, to soothe my nervous system, began to fold and roll cigarillos of vine leaves. I had learned the recipe in Cyprus while researching my latest book, a collection of recipes from all around the Eastern Mediterranean.

title: Hamas Attack on Israel Aims to Capitalize on Palestinian Frustration
summary: With rocket barrage, militant group tries to court young Palestinians behind eviction protests. When the secretive military chief of the Palestinian Islamist movement Hamas emerged from the shadows last week, he chose to weigh in on a land dispute in East Jerusalem, threatening to retaliate against Israel if Palestinian residents there were evicted from their homes.

title: Strong U.S. Economy, Stimulus Spurs Migrants to Send Billions of Dollars Home
summary: Global remittances to low- and middle-income economies fell 1.6% in 2020, defying expectations of a sharper drop. Foreign-born workers sent more than $500 billion back to their home countries in the developing world last year, as the economic recovery and generous government programs in areas such as the U.S. helped sustain a critical lifeline for poor nations still battling the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Mexico Invalidates Union Vote at GM Plant
summary: Action was announced after U.S. said it sought a review of the vote under USMCA. WASHINGTON-The Mexican Labor Ministry said it is invalidating a union vote at a General Motors Co. truck factory, after the U.S. asked for a review under the U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement.

title: Some, but Not All, of the Price Jump Is Transitory
summary: Costs of airfare, used cars and restaurant meals offer clues to inflation puzzle. The surge in prices in April was a shocker. Excluding food and energy, the core index rose 0.9% from March, the biggest one-month increase since 1981, and three times more than Wall Street expected. This was as surprising as the subdued April payroll increase reported just five days earlier.

title: Former TPG Executive Sentenced in College Admissions Case
summary: Mr. McGlashan admitted to participating in test-cheating scheme. Former private-equity star William McGlashan Jr. was sentenced Wednesday to three months in prison for paying a college counselor to fudge his son's college entrance exam score and boost the teen's chance of admission.

title: Pentagon Backs Off Xiaomi Blacklisting After Legal Challenge
summary: Chinese tech giant joins several peers that have successfully won courtroom reprieves against Trump-era actions. HONG KONG-The U.S. Defense Department agreed to remove Xiaomi Corp. from a blacklist banning U.S. investment in the Chinese tech giant, opting against further defending a Trump administration action that alleged ties between the smartphone maker and the Chinese military.

title: The Biden Tax Mirage
summary: Marginal rates have been a lot higher, but the actual share the top 1% pay stays remarkably constant.. With deficits at levels not seen since World War II, the March $1.9 trillion stimulus only beginning to spend out, and President Biden calling for significantly higher marginal tax rates to help fund another $4 trillion of spending, maybe it's time for a reality check on how high marginal tax rates, and the actual tax rates paid by Americans, can be raised without crushing economic growth. Proponents of massive tax increases will argue that economic growth and prosperity are compatible with high tax rates by pointing to the 35 years of postwar prosperity in America, when the top federal tax rate was 70% or higher.

title: Distance Learning Began in 1890
summary: Covid has brought us back to the future, in which the University of Chicago was a 20th-century pioneer.. The Covid-19 pandemic has accelerated higher education's move toward online classes. But as futuristic as Zoom and video streaming are, "distance learning" is nothing new.

title: India's Covid-19 Surge Adds Pressure to Seafarers Stranded at Sea
summary: Vessel operators are facing a revival of crew shortages as some major ports restrict sailors that have traveled to India. Shipping companies struggling with cargo bottlenecks are again facing a potential crewing crisis as major ports refuse to accept or replace Indian seafarers amid mounting Covid-19 infections across the South Asian country.

title: U.S. Emergency Broadband Benefit Will Help Families Pay for High-Speed Internet
summary: The $3.2 billion broadband aid program, which launches Wednesday, could also be boon for internet providers. title: Inflation Hits a High Note
summary: Prices are rising at their fastest clip in years, but the Fed is relaxed because expectations aren't embedded. Inflation might be picking up, but it isn't like people are singing songs about it.

title: Retire Your Aviators. These Are the Best Men's Sunglasses Now.
summary: As you re-emerge after timidly hiding at home, adopt spring's outsize, statement-making sunglasses and channel British actor Michael Caine. IN THE 1960S and '70s, droll British actor Michael Caine cemented his status as a global superstar with leading roles in films such as 1966's "Alfie" and 1972's "Sleuth," both of which earned him an Oscar nod. He also emerged as a style icon, thanks to his enviable good looks, smart Savile Row suits and chunky statement sunglasses. Now Caine-worthy shades-unapologetically thick, unexpectedly oversize and sexy in their intentional unsexiness-are cycling back into fashion, an ideal way to hide our tired eyes as we cautiously venture back outside.

title: Fed's Clarida 'Surprised' by Inflation Report, But Stresses Need to See More Data
summary: Central bank's vice chairman says Fed will monitor long-term inflation measures 'very closely' and act if they start to drift upward. title: Why Limited-Edition Art Merch for Monet and Van Gogh Keeps Selling Out
summary: Cheeky hats and T-shirts honoring artists are trending among the art-and style-cognoscenti. title: Why You Shouldn't Leave Family Property to Your Children
summary: Real estate often comes with emotional attachments, which can prevent heirs from making smart financial decisions. Malcolm Butler is the president and CEO of the Fiduciary Group in Savannah, Ga.

title: Amazon's Tax Victory Could Raise Its Bills
summary: Annulment of EU's decision to levy €250 million in back taxes will likely add fuel to crackdown on tax avoidance. U.S. tech giants face an awkward reality with their recent tax victories in Europe: The less they end up owing for past profits, the more they may be taxed on future ones.

title: Inquiry Into Early Covid Response Finds WHO Delays but Spares China
summary: Panel charged with examining policy failures doesn't criticize Beijing's early efforts to suppress news of the virus. The World Health Organization should be given the power to swiftly investigate threatening pathogens in any country, a review board established by the United Nations agency's leadership said, saying the agency took too long to declare Covid-19 a public-health emergency in early 2020.

title: FuboTV, Unity Software, Wendy's: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
summary: Futures pointed to another day of losses on Wall Street. Here's what we're watching ahead of Wednesday's opening bell.

title: A Boost for Wages-and Inflation
summary: In the two largest economies, plunging birthrates and aging populations squeeze the labor supply. The inflationary pressures now roiling the economy and markets will probably fade once the economy has fully reopened and the pandemic is in remission.

title: Amazon Wins Appeal Over $300 Million EU Tax Bill
summary: Court rules competition regulators failed to prove Amazon got a selective advantage from tax breaks. Amazon . com Inc. struck a new blow to European Union efforts to wring more tax from big tech companies when the bloc's second-highest court sided with the company over a $300 million tax bill.

title: What Does a Labor Shortage Mean for Unemployment Benefits?
summary: Several Republican-led states move to drop enhanced benefits, while the Biden administration works to encourage more people to seek employment. A growing gap between available workers and job openings has triggered a debate over whether pandemic-related unemployment benefits are keeping people from taking jobs. Several Republican-led states have moved to drop the enhanced benefits, and the Biden administration said it is taking steps to encourage more jobless people to seek employment. Here are some answers to questions about adjustments that are happening to jobless benefits.

title: Tencent's Biggest Shareholder Looks to Fix Valuation Snag
summary: Naspers takes action to narrow $100 billion valuation gap, unlock value for shareholders. JOHANNESBURG- Naspers Ltd. , Africa's most-valuable listed company, is taking another swipe at bridging a $100 billion valuation gap between its market capitalization and the value of its stake in Tencent Holdings Ltd. , long a headache for its investors.

title: Can a Smart Water Bottle Motivate You to Hydrate?
summary: We tested new high-tech carafes that promise to increase users' H20 intake using push alerts, redeemable point rewards and interactive tops. Some nudges worked better than others.. 'DRINK MORE water' has become a widely adopted healthcare mantra for a reason: Some doctors say that even mild dehydration can impair alertness and cognitive function. At this point, nearly a million Instagram posts are hashtagged #waterbottle and, after a particularly wellness-focused year, some people view their water bottles as high-status extensions of themselves.

title: Is "Clean" Beauty a Wash?
summary: A term that was first used by brands to distinguish themselves has, by virtue of its overuse, now made them indistinguishable.. "What does clean skin care mean?" According to Google, it's a question that was among the most popular skin-care searches of 2020. On Instagram alone the hashtag #cleanbeauty has nearly four million posts. Despite the proliferation of beauty brands dubbing themselves clean, and the success of stores that have chosen to focus narrowly on products that fall under that category, there is confusion about what it all means. That's likely because it doesn't really mean anything, says Cayli Cavaco Reck, founder of Knockout Beauty, a beauty boutique with locations in New York, Los Angeles and Bridgehampton. "Clean is just an opinion," says Cavaco Reck, who thinks the term is simply meant to signal a counterpoint to mainstream beauty. "There isn't a governing body deeming products 'clean.'"

title: Toyota Can Be a Tech Giant Too
summary: The Japanese auto maker hasn't attracted the same excitement around its electric-vehicle plans as the likes of General Motors and Volkswagen, but in some respects it is technologically ahead. Toyotas have a reputation for being reliable but unexciting, and the Japanese automotive giant that makes them can come across the same way. Yet it is likely more forward-thinking than it gets credit for.

title: Jay-Z, Tina Turner, Go-Go's to Be Inducted Into Rock Hall of Fame
summary: Other members of this year's diverse class include Carole King, Foo Fighters and Todd Rundgren. The Rock & Roll Hall of Fame announced its latest inductees on Wednesday: Jay-Z, Tina Turner, the Go-Go's, Carole King, Foo Fighters and Todd Rundgren will join the institution at the 36th annual ceremony, scheduled for Oct. 30 in Cleveland.

title: Migrants Take More Risky Paths to Illegally Enter U.S.
summary: Following border-wall expansion and faster removals to Mexico, migrants opt for remote mountain paths, boats and trains.

title: In Epic Games v. Apple Trial, an Unorthodox Judge Presides
summary: Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers has handled several cases involving both companies. U.S. District Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers says she abhors when lawyers use hyperbole and grandstand like they are Perry Mason. She says lunch breaks are the enemy of productivity and that parents ought to observe Pi Day by feeding children pies. And she says she helped her son find success as an aeronautical engineer by denying him videogames.

title: Daimler CFO Works to Separate Accounts, Debts and People Ahead of Truck Unit Spinoff
summary: The planned transaction is supposed to help boost the car maker's share price and market capitalization. Daimler AG's finance chief is divvying up the car maker's books, debts and finance workers ahead of the spinoff of the company's trucks business later this year.

title: Online Real Estate Got Too Hot to Handle
summary: Sector's stocks overheated in a pandemic frenzy relative to the cooler pace of industry transformation. Real estate 2.0 is still just knocking on disruption's door.

title: As India Hunkers Down to Fight Covid-19, Its Wounded Economy Braces for More Pain
summary: Businesses have closed and many have lost jobs as swaths of the country have gone back into lockdown. India's economy was bouncing back after a nationwide lockdown last year stifled consumer spending and pushed the country into a deep recession, but the recovery has now run headlong into a devastating surge of Covid-19.

title: Covid-19 Concerns and Chip Selloff Roil Taiwanese Market
summary: Taipei's main stock benchmark ended in the red for a third straight day, putting shares on the brink of a correction. Shares in Taiwan tumbled Wednesday, as a selloff gripped the crucial semiconductor sector and a flare-up in coronavirus infections rattled investors.

title: Housing-Market Surge Is Making the Cheapest Homes the Hottest
summary: Resume Subscription. The red-hot U.S. housing market is giving an extra boost to the cheapest houses, including many in historically stagnant neighborhoods that have suffered from a lack of investment.

title: As Ransomware Proliferates, Insuring for It Becomes Costly and Questioned
summary: With hackers seeking out companies with cyber insurance, insurers are pulling back and jacking up premiums as attacks show no sign of abating. Cyber insurers are raising prices and limiting coverage after a series of high-profile attacks and mounting claims from ransomware, amid concerns that insurance payouts are actually encouraging the hacking.

title: Bill Ackman, Paris Hilton, Ai Weiwei Headline Second Day
summary: Paris Hilton, chef José Andrés, artist Ai Weiwei and singer Jacob Collier are also set to speak on second day. Published May 12, 2021 5:30 am ET

title: Most Toyotas Will Still Use Gasoline in 2030, Company Says
summary: Car maker projects fast rise of hybrid gas-electric vehicles. TOKYO- Toyota Motor Corp. said most of its U.S. vehicles would still run on gasoline a decade from now because it doesn't think fully electric vehicles will have caught up in cost and convenience.

title: Carlos Ghosn's Former Aide Defends Himself in Tokyo Trial
summary: Greg Kelly denies hiding Ghosn's pay in first testimony on witness stand. TOKYO-Former Nissan Motor Co. executive Greg Kelly said he never conspired to hide Carlos Ghosn's pay, taking the stand in his own defense for the first time in the criminal trial involving disclosure of the former Nissan chief's compensation.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Stocks Slide on Inflation Data, Extending Decline
summary: The Dow and S&P 500 post their steepest three-day declines in nearly seven months. U.S. stocks extended their losses Wednesday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 posting their steepest three-day declines in nearly seven months, after a sharp rise in consumer prices heightened concerns about inflation.

title: Surge of Migrants at U.S. Southern Border: What You Need to Know
summary: Single adult men from Mexico are in search of jobs; families and unaccompanied children from Central America seek asylum; Biden administration's short-term options are few. WASHINGTON-The U.S. has been grappling with a surge of migrants from Mexico and Central America crossing the border illegally, and the Biden administration is on pace to preside over a 20-year high in illegal border crossings by the end of the federal budget year in September. The situation has created a political and policy challenge for the administration, which has struggled in particular to care for record numbers of unaccompanied children in its custody.

title: Arizona Republicans Pass Law Tightening Vote-by-Mail System
summary: Gov. Doug Ducey signs into law a new way to remove voters from the automatic mail-in ballot list. Republican lawmakers in Arizona passed a law that places new limits on mail ballots, marking another front in a nationwide fight over voting rules following the 2020 election.

title: Cheney Says GOP Can't Ignore Trump's Election Lie
summary: In address on eve of expected ouster from party leadership, congresswoman says ex-president is undermining democracy. WASHINGTON-Rep. Liz Cheney (R., Wyo.) said Republicans who ignored former President Donald Trump's continuing false claims of a stolen election were undermining democracy, in a defiant speech on the House floor on the eve of a vote expected to oust her from the House GOP's top ranks.

title: Beijing Confronts a Smaller, Grayer China Dream
summary: China is aging more rapidly than many expected, posing a serious challenge to its economic model. China is graying much more rapidly than many demographers expected. That won't be enough to derail its rise-but it will pose a serious challenge to its savings and export-heavy economic model. It could also mean a markedly smaller Chinese economy by midcentury than most mainstream economists expect.

title: Senate Committee Deadlocks on Vote Over Election Rules
summary: Democrats could use procedural tools to hold a Senate vote on rewriting rules on voting procedures, campaign finance and election oversight. A Senate committee deadlocked along party lines Tuesday over a sweeping Democratic election bill, illustrating the challenges party leaders will have passing the legislation through the full chamber.

title: Progressives, Conservatives Hone Messaging on Class Divide, Opportunity
summary: Oren Cass, J.D. Vance, Ro Khanna speak at WSJ's Future of Everything Festival. Author
